head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #8

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #8 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy, Transport at anchor in Sandusky bay, in the month of August 1813.

Fore part of this 24 Hours, light airs at SE & Clear warm weather, at noon sent Jonas on shore to cut some grass for the Genls Sheep, the other me employed fleeting down the fore racks, making stops for main sail & wind freshens from the ENE – cleared the Hold ready For receiving the Troops on board, about 1 PM observed a large smoke bearing WSW, suppose it to be the burning of some house on the banks of the Lake, heard this forenoon of our Troops still remaining inactive before a block House about 40 miles distant – at 8 PM to a look towards the Lake from the top mast head, but could see nothing – at 8 set the watch, now nearly calm & warm clear weather[.]

At 5 AM The troops return on board, after attacking the block house, in which action we loose a number of men, & 2 Officers, at 7 AM get under weigh the other Vessels in company, light airs at South, at 9 wind NNE & clear very warm weather, at noon wind ENE all sail set, the Ellen & self go through put in bay channel the Chippewa goes round the South end, at 3 PM pass by put in Bay, at 8 PM all the boats & Chippewa in sight ½ across between East sister & new settlement last part of this 24 hours little wind, came too off Hartleys Point in 2½ fathom water handed all sails, & set the watc[h,] showed a light for the boats until we came to, The Genl sets of for Sandwich in his boat, now calm[.]

At 6 AM get under weigh, the Chippewa in company, wind East & light, at 10 wind SW, at 11 came too above the Kings wharf handed all sails & moored to the Dover, discharged all the ordinance stores & went myself to Moy[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
